intro: Diploprora kusukusensis, commonly known as the Kusukus Island fern, is a rare tropical plant native to the island of Kusukus in the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, strap-like fronds that grow in a dense, clustered formation. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with numerous adventitious roots, which help it anchor in the moist, shaded undergrowth of its habitat. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of many ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
